text: Norma Zimmer (July 13, 1923 â€“ May 10, 2011) was an American singer and actress. She was best remembered for her 22-year tenure as Lawrence Welk's "Champagne Lady" on The Lawrence Welk Show, and for her love of traditional Christian music. She landed a small singing part in the Bing Crosby movie Mr. Music (1950), and provided the singing voice for the White Rose in the Disney movie Alice in Wonderland (1951). Zimmer died in Brea, California on May 10, 2011 at the age of 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1923 births Category:2011 deaths Category:American jazz singers Category:American movie actors Category:American voice actors Category:American television personalities Category:American radio actors Category:Actors from Idaho Category:Singers from Idaho
title: Norma Zimmer
